alert.note: Alert for Watauga (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 2:23PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Watauga County through 300 PM EDT... At 223 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Foscoe, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Boone... Blowing Rock... Foscoe... Blowing Rock In Caldwell County... Seven Devils... Aho... and Moses Cone Memorial Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
